https://www.firstbitefoods.com/menu 21/24

Address: 108 S Main St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Health-conscious American cafe with breakfast & vegan fare in modern digs with plants on the walls.

summary.snippet: "Amazing service, super friendly staff, and great food!"
"I like that they offer a variety of both meat and veggie options."
"Best if you like small meals - my husband ended up ordering 3 eggs to fill up."

most_relevant.description:
While visiting Ann Arbor I went to First Bite for an early lunch and thoroughly enjoyed the food and service.  Nice atmosphere and friendly people, but I especially liked the healthy options.  They serve breakfast and lunch.  I ordered the beet burger with their house potatoes.  Their burger sauce was delicious. .  Gluten-free options are available as well.  Everything tasted fresh and homemade.

They also have a full coffee bar and a selection of smoothies.  Highly recommend.

Good menu with some unique items and lots of vegetarian options. We enjoyed their Indian masala omelette and whole wheat pancakes. Pricing and portion size was reasonable. Service was slow on a busy Sunday morning, would try to get there earlier next time on a weekend.

Kind of a feel good (and eat healthy) diner-style cafe’. I decided to write this review because 1) besides the food being yummy, I was impressed that they *asked* how I like my bacon. That’s a first for me because I always have to ask for extra crispy in restaurants. 2) The customer service sign on the wall (see photo). 3) service with a smile. Even the person who wasn’t directly our weight staff.

Good options for vegans and non vegans but the service was lackluster. Servers didn’t know who had been waited on, looked like there were some communication issues? The poor family sitting near us though they had gluten free pancakes, since that is advertised all over the restaurant, but after assuring the customer that the ‘whole wheat’ they used was somehow gluten free, the server realized the mistake. Scary for someone with celiac! The Thai peanut wrap I got was really good, but the chips and guac tasted store bought.

I love to share  a great meal experience. The place is comfortable, people are friendly and the food is TASTY. This isn’t haute cuisine but it’s creative and simple. Nice omelet and gluten free pancakes. And the toast with jam!

Absolutely fantastic! We ordered 2 different bowls, a breakfast sandwich and smoothie.  All were very delicious.  You can tell quality ingredients are used and they take care in cooking and presentation.  Fantastic drip coffee too!  We will be back!

Went here today with vegan family members and non vegans. We sat on the patio and had the nicest time. Both staff members were so kind and accommodating. The food was absolutely delicious; I had the beef burger and it was one of the best burgers I’ve ever had, along with the breakfast potatoes. The homemade lemonade was just right. The tomato soup, turkey burger, and French toast were equally fresh and flavorful. They had kid sized water cups and even brought coloring books/crayons for the kids. We will be back!

The food was great! Fresh and had depth and flavor. Definitely recommend. Loved that, while busy, we didn't have the feeling if sitting on top of the table next to us. The near fully open restaurant gave you insight to how things were prepped, and it was fresh, delivered straight to you steaming hot. It was busy, so we didn't get many touch points with our waitress - if we didn't know what we wanted, if she stopped by, we wouldn't see her again. Yet, that doesn't take away from a great breakfast experience where we ealked away super full and content.
